etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Thomas Huxley (1825–1895), biologist and science educationist. From scientific Latin monostomus; compare -stome

definitions: Having a single mouth or mouthlike structure; specifically (of a digenean trematode) lacking a ventral sucker and having only an oral sucker.
An animal with a single mouth or mouthlike structure; specifically a monostome trematode.
